meanings.definition: To remove material that is considered improper or offensive from a text.
meanings.sent1: The teacher bowdlerized the book before giving it to the students.
meanings.sent2: The editor bowdlerized the article to make it suitable for all readers.
meanings.sent3: The librarian bowdlerized the novel, making it safe for young readers.
meanings.sent4: She bowdlerized the speech, ensuring it was appropriate for the audience.
meanings.sent5: The parent bowdlerized the movie, making it family-friendly.

meanings.definition: To censor or edit a work by removing or changing parts deemed inappropriate.
meanings.sent1: The committee bowdlerized the film to comply with regulations.
meanings.sent2: The government bowdlerized the document to hide sensitive information.
meanings.sent3: The artist bowdlerized the painting, removing controversial elements.
meanings.sent4: He bowdlerized the play, cutting scenes that were too graphic.
meanings.sent5: The author bowdlerized the manuscript, toning down explicit content.
